feed.title: File Browser Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for File Browser: v2.32.0
entry.content:
Changelog

  • 3d6c5152fe22a4a47783253a3506a2930b7b6be3 chore(release): 2.32.0
  • ba797cda3135eddb9b7165dc5ceb932399cb54df build: fix go releaser
  • 5300d00d2e7dbb80a252aff57e100113f02506c3 fix: Fix user creation on proxy auth (#3666)
  • bbdd313705b8d253f0c47ad717a6e47b2f46e719 fix: disk usage refreshing (#3692)
  • 045064f8b8bf9f86058e877448085e38da8b3f2e fix: add proper healthcheck for S6 containers (#3691)
  • 252f0a753323f7981fde1da22f2e08cdb69b531b chore: update ko.json (#3688)
  • 1194cfe0097a70399c1f06cf0f514b9d70fa463c build(deps): bump golang.org/x/net from 0.23.0 to 0.33.0 (#3712)
  • 0201f9c5c4dd2a4d5a3503e59cdb8045e8d3a91f refactor: Fix eslint warnings (#3698)
  • cc331383fb3f0fd6ddbd775a29c82ee4c64f5012 chore: add translation for the "Hide dot files setting" in "es" (Spanish) language (#3704)
  • d1c84a84123c77dede05c023b3697a432b56122c fix: prompts disappearing on copy / move / upload (#3537)
  • e92dbb4bb8b7894264fbf0a48a641712c3b68766 build(deps): bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.26.0 to 0.31.0 (#3634)
  • 209acf2429b06e2e8d78218937c59fd7e7edd1be feat: create user on proxy authentication if user does not exist (#3569)
  • 25372edb5c0e616e82b76b5f523633af57d347e0 build(deps): bump cross-spawn from 7.0.3 to 7.0.6 in /tools (#3601)
  • d51a3438201274a1b826be1b775ca1035ade20c5 build: update to node 22 and pnpm (#3616)
  • 065959451d3ba12019c6151274aa4e6904cdca99 build(deps): bump vue-i18n from 9.10.2 to 9.14.2 in /frontend (#3618)
  • 2fdea73430011846276a1cda52458f1d670f5ea7 build(deps): bump github.com/golang-jwt/jwt/v4 from 4.5.0 to 4.5.1 (#3574)

entry.title: New release for File Browser: v2.33.0
entry.content:
Docker Image Updates

The volumes of the Alpine Docker images have been updated to align with the s6-overlay images. This is important for users using the filebrowser/filebrowser:latest. In addition, the default user running inside Docker is no longer root, in order to avoid further security issues.

You now need to mount the directories containing the settings and the database, and not the files themselves. This allows File Browser to automatically initialize all necessary database and settings without the user's intervention, and avoids the issue where Docker creates a directory when we're expecting a file (see #3719 for example).

[!WARNING]

For now, the Docker image has a workaround to make sure that current installations work as intended. If you changed the entrypoint, command, or flags of the filebrowser command in your Docker installation, there's no guarantee that it'll work. The workaround will be removed in future versions.

Assuming you have a database.db and .filebrowser.json files, do the following:

  1. Change the path of database in .filebrowser.json to /database/filebrowser.db
  2. Rename database.db to filebrowser.db
  3. Rename .filebrowser.json to settings.json
  4. Put them in the same directory locally, let's say /app/filebrowser/
  5. Mount with the flags -v /app/filebrowser:/database -v /app/filebrowser:/config - you can also choose to put them in separate directories, but it is not needed.

For more details, check the documentation: https://github.com/filebrowser/filebrowser/blob/v2.33.0/docs/installation.md#docker.

Changelog

  • e9bb3dc243eb64b2a7da1bd17feb26bd83e06216 chore(release): 2.33.0
  • 2e26393a022df0eaa9e08727407aba8b997aa728 feat: improved docker image volumes and permissions (#5160)
